column4: hey, I install firefox 3.5.5 in ubuntu, but it still shows up as 3.0 on the "About" page
do you install manually or use Ubuntu update method?
I tried with the synaptic package manager
Ubuntu version?
sorry it is 9.04
: in 9.04, run "shiretoko" instead of firefox
what's that?
: the codename for FF 3.5
oh... do I have to uninstall firefox 3.0 first?
: if you wish
: don't recommend tought...
: just create a new shortcut in the menu
shiretoko is not in the list...
: try adding a new shortcur
: Right click on your menu and select edit menu
: You can create the shortcut anywhere you want, just make sure in the command field, you type in "shiretoko"
you've totally lost me.. Do I have to install shiretoko first?
: "Shiretoko" is the app name of Firefox 3.5 in ubuntu 9.04
oh
: if you already installed FF3.5, the command to run it is "shiretoko", this is to differ from the default FF3.0 in 9.04
bash: shiretoko: command not found
